Kamisama Hajimemashita, or Kamisama Kiss is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Julietta Suzuki and serialized by Hakusensha in the shoujo manga magazine called ‘Hana to Yume.’ An anime television series adaptation of Kamisama Kiss was produced by ‘TMS Entertainment’ and directed by Akitaro Daichi (Fruits Basket, Kaleido Star). It began airing on October 1, 2012. There are also two OVA episodes, which first aired on August 26, 2013, bundled with the 16th volume of the manga. One of the included episodes is based on the story from the 15th volume, while the other contains an all-new original story. The 17th issue ofHakusensha's Hana to Yume magazine announced on August 2014 that the manga series inspired a second anime season, which began airing on January 5, 2015.


Momozono Nanami is only 17 years old, but she has never felt lucky. She has quite an average academic progress and boys do not think that she is cute. She would love to fix her school problems and spare more time for the girls’ stuff, but she cannot do that, since her father is a big gambler, who always causes her daughter a ton of problems. Too bad, but her misfortune only continues: she is evicted from her apartment, because of her father’s debts. 


However, Nanami does not curse her misfortune. One day, she saves a good-looking young man in a park from a huge phobia he has; he is afraid of dogs. After a small talk, the young man listens to Nanami’s problems and offers her to live at his place, which he abandoned 20 years ago. In addition to this, he also kisses her on the forehead to express his gratitude. It turns out that Nanami is invited to live in a God’s shrine and that the young man that kissed her actually passed her the mark of the area’s deity. The unfortunate girl is no longer unfortunate, but her life has not gotten any easier, too. She now should take care of her academic progress, as well as of her deity’s duties. 


While Kamisama Kiss’ story-line does look generic, it still manages to show its uniqueness. The story-line does a great job explaining characters’ motives and their backstories, but the most important thing about it is, of course, the fact that it manages to keep the viewer interested. Kamikiss is a romantic comedy, however, sometimes it gets very dark and it also focuses on some philosophical topics. And after some time you will surely appreciate the fact that the creator of Kamikiss understands that watching a pure romantic comedy for two seasons is just boring and that she can also make you forget about the romance and to make you simply worry about the characters of Kamikiss. However, after 19 minutes of fear you hear the anime’s ending song and understand that it is all over. 


The visuals are not great, but there is nothing to complain about. Backgrounds are often gorgeous and the anime also pays attention to many important details. Sound wise, it is quite difficult to say if this anime should be watched in English, or in Japanese; they both are good, so feel free to watch it in whatever language you wish. The anime has also a very calming OST; whenever you hear the anime’s ending, it just warms your heart.


Character wise, there are two main characters and also a big supporting characters cast. The first main character, she is voiced by Mimori Suzuko and Ballard Tia, is Nanami Momozono. She is a teenage girl, who is having quite a difficult life. She has quite an average academic progress and boys do not think that she is cute. She would love to fix her school problems and spare more time for the girls’ stuff, but she cannot do that, since her father is a big gambler, who always causes her daughter a ton of problems. Too bad, but her misfortune only continues: she is evicted from her apartment, because of her father’s debts. Thankfully, a young man listens to Nanami’s problems and offers her to live at his place, which he abandoned 20 years ago. In addition to this, he also kisses her on the forehead to express his gratitude. After some time, it turns out that Nanami is invited to live in a God’s shrine and that the young man that kissed her passed her the mark of the area’s deity, which changed her life a lot. The second main character is Tomoe, who is voiced by Tachibana Shinnosuke and Tatum John Michael. Tomoe is a fox yokai, who serves as the familiar of the land God Mikage. However, one day, Mikage leaves his shrine, leaving Tomoe alone. After 20 years, Mikage makes Nanami the new mistress of the shrine, and so it makes Tomoe her familiar now. At first, the fox youkai does not appreciate the fact that he now has a new master, who is just a schoolgirl and, of course, a human. However, because of something, he changes his opinion about Nanami and starts to care about her. 


That being said, both main characters receive good character development. Though, you will only find out more about Tomoe in the second season; it is not that important. I guess you will surely appreciate the fact that both main characters change as the anime progresses. You will also like the fact that there is a huge supporting characters cast, which will not make you feel bored. 


If you want to know my personal opinion on this anime, I would say that it is one of the best romance anime I have ever seen in my life. I am not a fan of that genre, and ‘ shoujo’ is definitely not my favorite genre. However, Kamikiss, somehow, won my interest. It manages to keep you interested, because it has a very misleading first episode, which will surely form a very wrong opinion on this anime. However, the more you watch it, the more you understand that this anime is not that simple. It tries to make you feel secure, but then it says ‘hey, you cannot feel relaxed yet, we have plenty of ways to make you worry about the characters.’


Overall, I cannot say that Kamisama Kiss is an absolute masterpiece. However, as a romance it did manage to keep me interested. I would not recommend this anime for someone, who does not like romance; just avoid this anime if you are not a fan of the genre. However, if you are a big sucker for a good romance anime, then you should definitively give this show a try; it will not disappoint you.

 Kamisama Hajimemashita is a great romance-comedy type of anime with lovable characters. A stubborn, clumsy but caring girl becomes a Land God. Helping her with her deities is a handsome, kind of irritated and loyal Tomoe-a demon fox. With a bunch of secondary characters, who are unique, the plot becomes very appealing. I can say that comedy takes over romance in this one. The very first episode showed me that i would have a good time watching the anime with all its laughable moments. Aside from comedy, the anime has a strong main character,which doesn't lead to boredom. The visuals are good, the voice acting and music fit perfectly and I can say that overall this anime is a short, but good journey, filled with laughter and emotion.

My overall score was an 9. I'm sorry but it just had some missing things that I really wanted covered. I'm a huge fan of the manga, but the anime ended so early missing a whole plot line. *sigh* I might have been expecting too much, but it is one of my favorite manga of all time. The story is just overall lighthearted and romantic I adore this story line so much. The opening and closing song are both enjoyable. I usually am one to get annoyed with some opening songs but with Kamisama Hajimemashita's opening theme song I found myself listening to it afterI finished the anime.

My friend introduced me to this anime, and to be honest, after listening to the opening song I thought that this anime would be really cheesy. I'm usually very picky about what I see and read, meaning I drop anime/manga rather quickly and easily. Two days later I was done with the anime. A day later I started reading the manga and finished within a week. Yup, I was shamelessly addicted. 
The story (9/10):
I believe the story is original. Of course it has its archetypes and cliches but it isn't like any other anime that I've seen. Furthermore, there aren't many plot holes (at leastI couldn't find one)...rather, it's the complete opposite! Anyone who has read the manga would agree with me that the story is really well planned out. I'm looking forward to what will happen. I'm pretty excited because I can trust that the writer will do a good job. 


The art (10/10):

This is one of the rare anime that has art that beautifully preserved the style of the manga's. 


The sound (9/10):

Dat Tomoe's Soundtrack. 


The characters (9/10):

I absolutely adore all the characters of this anime. Nanami, the protagonist, isn't some weakling who relies on handsome men to do all her work. No, no, Nanami knows how to stand up for herself, voices her opinion, and isn't afraid of being different. I also like how Tomoe and Mizuki develop throughout the anime. As the anime progresses (and will continue to do so in Season 3) little bits of their pasts are revealed, but at the same time their mystery, which is what keeps them interesting, is kept. 


The enjoyment (10/10):

This anime is a drug. It's one of those anime that takes you on a violent emotional rollercoaster ride, makes you feel all the feels, and then leaves you with this massive hole in your heart when it's over. There isn't a single boring moment in the anime. 


Overall (10/10):

In my opinion, this anime would mostly interest girls (not trying to be sexist. Just sayin'). Anyone looking for gory, complete action-packed anime probably wouldn't enjoy this. Nevertheless, I enjoyed this anime and strongly encourage others to give it a shot. Watch at least the first 3 episodes!

STORY (10/10): Let me just say first that I read all but the last two volumes of Kamisama Kiss before I watched the anime (sadly, the last two aren't out in America yet). I was really hoping that the anime wouldn't stray from the manga too much and I wasn't disappointed. There were a couple of things that changed -- that ending, though -- but I didn't necessarily find them to be bad changes. They didn't detract from the overall story, so they were just fine in my book. 
ART (8/10): The art style in this was nothing new, but itwas still beautiful. The colors were great especially. I'd say the only thing I didn't really like about it was the bubbly/hazy/rainbow backgrounds they had sometimes, but they really didn't come as a surprise, considering the type of anime this is. 


SOUND (8/10): The OP on this was kind of catchy. I don't think I ever skipped it. The ending theme was pretty good as well. And let's just take a moment to appreciate the fact that Kurama has his own freaking theme song. I found that especially amusing. The voice acting was enjoyable, although after watching the first episode in dub, I switched to sub and stayed there. I respect Tia Ballard and she's a phenomenal voice actress, but I couldn't watch Nanami talk with the voice of Happy from Fairy Tail. I especially noticed it when she was yelling. It really pulled me out of the anime, so I decided that switching was best. This was just one of those anime that felt like it lost something in translation. The Japanese voice actors did an amazing job on this one.


CHARACTER (10/10): The characters in this anime are great. While there isn't a lot of development, the characters are noticeably changed by the end of the season. I found myself anxiously wondering what was going to happen next (even though I already knew what was going to happen) and how each character was going to react to certain events. I absolutely love the fact that Nanami didn't become this overpowered god, but her powers were instead very limited. Even so, she wasn't this totally useless and helpless character. She could actually fend for herself if need be, even if it was just long enough for Tomoe to get there to save the day. Tomoe himself was just as mysterious, arrogant, brooding, and angry as I'd hoped he would be. His dark past was only hinted at, so I'm curious to see how it's handled as the series progresses.


ENJOYMENT (10/10): I loved this anime. It stayed true to the manga, it presented the characters perfectly, and it didn't add in any pointless filler. 


OVERALL (9/10): Averaged out, Kamisama Kiss gets a score of 9. An extremely enjoyable anime in my opinion. I can't wait to see the rest of this!

Kamisama Hajimemashita or Kamisama Kiss was made over a decade ago, but that’s not enough to compensate for how cliche and typical it was. There have been several shows that feature a headstrong lead woman who believes if she tries to do her best, she can do anything; and in effect, other characters find themselves drawn to her. I guess the plot line was somewhat different - I mean, it’s not everyday that an ordinary high schooler is chosen to become a god out of whim. However, for something released after the likes of Kachou wa Maid-sama and Special A, it was just okay. 
Appealfor the series probably comes from the so-called forbidden master-servant affair; supernatural taboo making it all the more sweet. It could have been more enticing if the romance were less forced and the two actually had chemistry. What’s more is that the presumed charisma from the main character caused an unnecessary, nonsensical reverse harem. Many things that are unexplained are either attributed to the magic/other worldly powers or left up in the air.\n\n
At the end, the anime can be described as, well, cute. Adorable, sure. Good, though, I’m not so certain.

What a charming anime!! Nanami is a high school girl that gets kicked out of her house because her father left her in debt. When she meets a stranger who says she can take his place at her house, she finds herself lead to a shrine. Inhabited by two helpful shrine spirits and Tomoe, the fox spirit who becomes her familiar and thus caretaker/servant, Nanami realises that she has to now become the Land God of that shrine. This involves tasks such as cleaning, performing rituals and matchmaking. Vibrant and hilarious, this anime does a great job at weaving in a few somber aspects intothe overall fun nature of this feature, creating something truly magical!


So I’ll start of with Tomoe and Nanami’s relationship because that plays a big part in the whole anime. Initially, Tomoe feels betrayed that Nanami is taking the place of his old master and is quite cold towards her. When he sees what a swell personality she has, he actually warms up to her at quite a rapid pace, but it surprisingly doesn’t feel unnatural. I think we can put that up to the fact that we are always left wondering whether the kindness Tomoe shows Nanami is because he is obliged to serve her as her familiar, or whether there is something more brewing. A lot of the scenes had the potential to show him as an overbearing and self-torturing guy, yet it managed to dodge that and always pulled it off with him acting sweet as sugar.


Nanami as a protagonist is really likeable because she is quite selfless, yet she does go out of her way to preserve her relationship with Tomoe. Her heartwarming nature earns her many friends in this anime including a bunch of awesome and varied side characters:


We have Mizuki, a familiar that can turn himself into a snake. A very cute snake though! After being saved by Nanami, he develops this strong admiration for her and tries to pull her attention away from Tomoe to focus it towards him. When he realises that’s not going to happen, he stays close to her and helps her out, accepting defeat graciously. He was actually one of my favourite characters because you really feel for his loneliness and his desire to have a place to belong and to have someone strongly devoted to him. He is also hilarious when he sparks jealousy within Tomoe and manages to break his steely exterior.


Kurama is another spirit who initially had the goal of taking Nanami’s place as a God, yet later grew into a helpful friend when Nanami and Tomoe were in a pickle…one which involved Tomoe turning into a toddler: 


As he is a famous pop-idol, this strange background music plays whenever he enters the scene, which felt kind of ridiculous, but hey, it at least had comedic appeal. Speaking of comedic appeal, this show has many instances of hilarious moments, including one in which Tomoe takes the place of Nanami and is there to witness Kurama’s brash flirting. Fun times ensue. Oh and did I forget the time when Kurama got turned into an ostrich and got chased around the school by Tomoe? Their combined scenes are quite entertaining.


Another character of interest include, Mikage, the God that left the shrine to Nanami in the first place. Throughout the anime, we begin to unravel that he may have done this to resolve some issues of Tomoe’s past and this leads us to question Nanami’s link to Tomoe’s past. For this reason, I’m getting the same kind of vibes for this anime as both Inuyasha, for the twisted reincarnation relationships and similar dog/fox based characters. Also Noragami, due to the elements of shrines, Gods and characters having potentially dark pasts.


I really enjoyed the art style and the character design, especially of Nanami. The hair curling around her face and always rosy cheeks seems unique and really fits with her character. The soundtrack is also something that really sucked me in. The opening song really fits the whole lightly rebellious and carefree nature that is predominantly present during this anime and even the ending song has the sweet nature that suits Nanami’s character


So the plot basically revolves around Nanami’s developing relationship with both Tomoe and her powers as a God. Nanami’s kindness is saccharine sweet as she goes about matchmaking for her friends and dealing out sympathy for her kidnappers and those that wish to do her harm. Her desire to make others happy and take care of the shrine prevails over the dark discoveries that weave a backstory about Tomoe’s past. Overall, this is a delightful anime which is really the whole package. Though it focuses so much on the romance, the plot is never brushed under the rug - go watch it and fall in love!

~Story~ 8 
Okay so let me give you the layout. This story is about High schooler Nanami Momozono. This anime begins with her absentee father being in such extreme debt that they lose everything, and she gets kicked out from her home. Downtrodden and homeless, she runs into a man being harassed by a dog. After helping him, she explains her situation, and to her surprise, he offers her his home in gratitude. But when she discovers that said home is a rundown shrine, she tries to leave; however, she is caught by two shrine spirits and a fox familiar named Tomoe. They mistake herfor the man Nanami rescued—the land god of the shrine, Mikage. Realizing that Mikage must have sent her there as a replacement god, Tomoe leaves abruptly, refusing to serve a human. Rather than going back to being homeless, Nanami immerses herself in her divine duties. But if she must keep things running smoothly, she will need the help of a certain hot-headed fox. In her fumbling attempt to seek out Tomoe, she lands in trouble and ends up sealing a contract with him. After that their relationship grows stronger as the anime progresses, and miss nanami touches the heart of every person she meets. \n

Okay that is exceedingly high from how I would normally put it but I thought this anime was just so adorable and sorta romantic and well I just couldn’t help but love it. **NO SPOLIERS** 
The best word I have to describe Kamisama Hajimemashita is ridiculous. It is extremely comical, heartwarming, unrealistic, and a joy to watch. That being said I really love shojo, supernatural/ayakashi, and romance anime and if you don't like any of those things this probably isn't the best show for you and the few low ratings it's been given I'm sure are coming from people who may want something more realistic/slice of life-esque which this anime is absolutely not. I have read what is released of the manga and watched the anime completely (OVAs included) and it is one of my all-time favorites.
Overall thisanime is a 10/10 and I gladly rewatch some of my favorite episodes when I need a pick me up. 


Now to reviewing the elements...


Story: 8/10


The reason I gave this an 8/10 was because it sticks true to the manga for the most part, there are definitely elements that couldn't fit into an anime adaptation (especially for the first season) and there were a couple aspects that were rushed in terms of following the manga. However, the general story follows the manga. 


Art: 10/10

I think the animation was really beautiful and used to enhance the story and characters as depicted in the manga making an anime adaptation success in my book. The character design was completely true to the manga and the use of bright colors throughout the anime really brought the whimsical nature of the manga to the screen very well. 


Sound: 10/10

THE SOUND REALLY WAS THE SELLING POINT FOR ME ON THE ANIME. I am a sucker for good sound design and Kamisama Hajimemashita hit it out of the park in this aspect. The music used in the scenes are modern interpretations of traditional music and traditional instruments which fit the nature of the anime very well seeing as a major part of the story is bringing traditional elements of living in a shrine to "everyday" life. The opening is cute and fits well, the song choice definitely isn't one of my favorite openings, but sound isn't all about openings and closings. 


Character: 9/10

The characters are hilarious, very individual in their personalities which make for hilarious interactions-- just as it is in the manga. The development is slightly rushed in the beginning, however not unusual for a season of 12 episodes. I love Nanami's character because she is realistic as a high school girl despite not being a normal high schooler whatsoever-- When Kurama is introduced the fangirl aspect made her character more relatable as a high schooler. Tomoe's character is so opposite of Nanami-- responsible and decisive that again it provides for hilarious interactions between them. The rest of the characters I love and I felt somewhat attached to them as I continued watching. The characters themselves are 10/10 but the slightly rushed development is what made me knock it down to a 9/10.

I cannot even express how well this story is made, if I could I would give it 10000/10. This is my ultimate favourite anime/manga and I think nothing will top it. I just makes me feel so happy, watching this.
Main point to praise is Nanami, the female protagonist, she may seem very weak (which, is implied as she is always mentioned a mere human or being called a weakling by Tomoe and various people) but she becomes much stronger throughout the story. Although I say that, she needs Tomoe a lot in parts that she is not strong with - which is also why thisis a lovely, romance anime.\n\n
I JUST LOVE THIS SO MUCH

I love this anime, I really do. They came out with a second season so I re-watched the first season and I still love it. 
Story:
A girl loses her home and is given (not 100% willingly) a new home. Now some of you are going to say "how was it unwilling?" well that's because the house has an ownership, like a car except this one is given and cannot be returned easily, especially when the previous owner disappears. Anyways it is a comedy, action, and a love story. I am female so that is my perfect combination. 
Art:
Soft colours and many subtle things that givethe anime that "ooh" factor. From little blue butterflies to a cloudless night full of stars. Pretty straightforward but it still makes me smile at the sense of calmness the anime portrays.\n
Sound:\n
I love the theme song. Not much in the way of sound throughout the anime but I also feel it was well thought out. There was a narrator in the beginning which I think they did better then if it was a memory because it only explained the pertinent details and not all the other crap that goes along with flashbacks. Wait does this statement belong with sound? \n
Characters:\n
Throughout the whole anime the main characters are growing and becoming stronger both in body and mind it is fascinating to see and relish in when they finally understand something and are able to make the proper amendments to their own mistakes and become perfection.\n
I love all the characters even the ones I probably shouldn't have liked ;)\n
Enjoyment:\n
I LOVE LOVE L-O-V-E this anime, one of my favorites. Honestly it is pure joy.\n
WATCH IT!!!

This is my first anime review but it only seems appropriate to write my first review for my favorite anime. The anime is mainly about a young girl whose house goes into foreclosure due to her fathers debt. She is obviously devastated and is left out on a bench not sure what to do when a strange voice calling for help followed by barks call her attention. She rescues the strange screaming man stuck in the tree from the dog simply by showing it love and in such great thanks this strange yet charismatic man gives her his home! She doesn't want to be ungratefulfor she has no where to go anyways and takes the man up on his offer. When she arrives at her new home it's simply a rotten old shrine with a gloomy aura, but that isn't the only surprise. There are creepy voices and a strangely attractive yet freaky fox demon to greet her. And that's how the first episode begins. \n\n
Overall the anime is hilarious and brought me a ton of joy. I would suggest reading the manga because the story line and art really come into the play and it's beautiful and my favorite manga as well. Tomoe is the main male character and I gotta say he's your classic cold hearted good looking guy who has a soft spot for that one special girl. Nanami is the main female character and she is light hearted, giving, and has a beautiful personality for a 2d anime characte. All the funny and lovably characters really makes the anime a favorite. I strongly suggest you give this anime a chance as well as the manga I believe you will truly enjoy the art. This is also the most different romantic comedy I've ever watched, it's different and will simply bring you joy.

Ok, this's my first review and is for the anime adapted of my favorite manga. A little hard, hun? But the thing is: even I LOVING the manga, I really have some problems watching the anime. Yeah, it's loyal, but I think that could be much better than was. 
Apart from this, the anime is PRETTY GOOD. It's cute, have some awesome characters and the admissible songs. Ok, being honest, the ending isn't it all, but it's nice, and the opening is okay enough. 
The anime was short, so I think they had to do things short. If you don't read the manga, you'll beokay with that, 'cause the end was cute, lovely and all the thing  we dreamed in our favorites animes. But for me... I don't know, I just feel like if they they were to do a second season, so the first couldn't have that kind of end. All was fluffy (like Tomoe's ears, hehe) and all, but this bothered me.


Ok, talking about Tomoe, I've to say: I just love the most part of the characters. Nanami, the main, is smart, kind and persistent, and it makes me really like her. Tomoe is the guy I want for me, and I can say that he have my heart now. Being rough, and sometimes being so sweet... Mizuki, Mikage, Kurama, these were others that I liked. 


In the end, I can say  I really like the anime. It's nice see a manga creating life. And, no matter what I said, I hope that have a second season. 


PS: People, my English isn't very good, but I tried. I just felt I had to express myself about this anime.

OMG THIS ANIME IS MY FAVOURITE ANIME OF ALL TIME AND I GUESS IM GONNA BE KINDA BIAST WITH THIS REVIEW BUT OW WELL.
Basically, the story is that a girl called Nanami gets given the role of land god by a random stranger called Mikage. The plot is then based around how she deals with these new duties and her familiar Tomoe.

After being an avid reader of the Manga series, I was greatly looking forward to delving into this anime.
Though, it seems to stick quite well to the manga for the most part, I find it lacked the same excitement that the books did. When carried over to an anime I found it dull at times and slow moving at others. I had to watch it in between other anime, and could not sit through more than three episodes at a time.
The art does not disappoint. It's the cutesy style and light palette that you know and love from Shojo anime series, and doesn't lack inthe detail department.


As far as the intros and openings go I found them very fitting and overall adorable. I could actually sit through them at the start and end of the episodes without being thoroughly sick of them by the end of the series. A+ for that. 


If you read the manga the characters are sure to not disappoint, though without having read it first you might find them a bit flat and cliche. "Young school  girl falls in love with semi-out of reach male." sums it up pretty well. 


I find no re-watch value in this series, however. It was definitely worth watching, even though it was dull at times. I would recommend it for a rainy day when you need something light and cheery to pick you up.

Now that the English dubbed version of this anime is soon to come out, I should probably write a review of it.  That said, this review is of the _subtitled version_ of this anime.
I hope anyone reading this will at least try this anime - it's a delight and one of the few shows that I watch over and over again.  There is no single part of it that I don't treasure - and not a single character I don't like.  It's wonderful!
The story is probably the part I like the most.  It's got a credible and sympathetic female lead thatfinds herself without a home or income.  She's quite ordinary except for her incredible fearlessness and her ability to remain positive despite a very difficult childhood.  The tale of how she meets and falls in love with the male lead; a brusque, snarky fox yokai that works as a 'familiar' for the local land god, is precious.  


You can read the summary of the story for yourself, but it can't express the charm and chemistry of the two main characters' relationship.  Tomoe is most decidedly 'fox-like' in his aloofness and snark, but Nanami's bright personality gets to him anyway.  Nanami, who, it seems, has never been able to rely on anyone, falls for Tomoe's strength and incongruous-seeming concern for her despite his repeated assertion that yokai and humans can't fall in love with one another.


The main characters grow and mature even over the short span of 13 episodes and you end up cheering for them. Side characters are charming, well crafted and add to the story perfectly.  The anime is beautifully drawn with the perfect style to suit the story, a lovely pallet that's just a little misty at the edges - not too artsy, ethereal or saccharine but sweet and grounded.  The musical score is bright and charming and suits the story too; nothing that memorable - it just blends into the mood overall - which is probably the best thing it could do!


I like the pacing - it doesn't have any slow spots, keeps the viewer engaged and following the story without having too many redundancies or making assumptions that the viewer will understand something that a foreign viewer might not.  I really appreciate that!  It translates very well to an American audience, or at least everyone I've ever shown it to has felt so, and I am so pleased to see it coming out dubbed. 


After all these positives, I tried to think of some negatives, but nothing immediately comes to mind.  It’s too short – IMHO – and there’s lots more interesting stuff past the thirteen episodes and one OVA in the manga if they ever wanted to do a season 2, but that’s really all the criticism I could think of for this program.  It’s lovely and one of my few ‘MUST SEE’ animes.

This anime is such a breath of fresh air! It's one of my top animes. I'll say right away that you won't enjoy this if you're more into the steamy, ecchi or hentai romances. This anime is sweet and funny and I loved it.
This anime is flawlessly executed; it has beautiful artwork, a funny but meaningful storyline, interesting and lovable characters, and a sweet and believable romance. It's not the first anime to examine the relationship between humans and youkai, but in my opinion it's one of the best. 
Story: 10
The beginning was kind of crazy, but once I got through it, the story flowedreally well. This is not your typical high school romance, although there are hints of it. The focus here is on Nanami and Tomoe, two drastically different people from different worlds, and how they clash. The story was funny (I actually cried laughing at some parts) but there are serious and touching moments to it as well. I thought the pacing was just right - the two main characters have to learn to love each other, and I thought that was great. The spiritual elements to the story weren't overwhelming either - they were nice touches to a great romance.


Art: 10

My biggest pet peeve in animes is ridiculous artwork, and I'm happy to say I didn't find that in this anime. I thought both the character artwork and the background artwork were nicely balanced, and the characters were all so beautiful! Especially Tomoe - I think I fell in love with him, like, the first time I saw him! Absolutely exceptional.


Sound: 9

The opening theme is so catchy! I found myself singing along, even though I don't speak a word of Japanese lol. The music throughout the show was well suited to different situations, and I found the music even added to the magic of key scenes. The ending theme wasn't as great, but I usually don't like ending themes anyways.


Character: 10

Every character in this anime worked well with each other. The dynamics in the relationships in this anime were hilarious and perfect. I loved every character, and they were so unique and real it blew my mind. The main characters - Nanami and Tomoe - are perfect. Not only for each other, but for the anime. Nanami is so cute and determined, and Tomoe balances her out with his dangerous allure and sarcastic (almost cruel) sense of humour. They revolve around each other and in the anime so beautifully it's fantastic.


Enjoyment/ overall: 10

I recommend this anime 100%! I enjoyed it so much I even went to go read the manga, which is saying something because I usually don't have the patience to read through mangas. The story is so superb, and Nanami and Tomoe are probably my favourite couple (they're currently battling it out with Sawako and Kazehaya). I haven't rewatched this anime yet, but I probably will. Several times.

I was really surprised by how much I liked this one.  It's a great companion to the manga.
I love this style of art, first of all.  The music, too, was pleasant.  The overall sound and scenery was very well done.
The story is fun.  There's no main arc besides Nanami becoming a land god, but I liked that.  The episodes were enjoyable and lighter than the manga.  The characters were funny and had their own unique personalities.  I would say that they were very memorable.  I enjoyed the story too, because I could sympathize with Nanami as wellas laugh with her.  Fair warning: the romance is really slow.  It's great and well written, but they don't get together right away, and I liked that a lot too.  The story dealt more with personal character growth and relationship growth rather than romance.  The "harem" factor (if you can even call it that) was also well done because the guys were not overwhemingly in love with her and confessing to her.  It was a great anime.\n
Highly recommend this!

Finished this anime today. Don't have a lot to say, but here we go. 
The good:
- Solid romance story, nothing unpredictable or heartbreaking. Just a "sweet little fairy tail".
- Soundtrack fit the theme really well and although it's not "my cup of tea", it was in tact with everything going on in the show, which helped a lot. 
- There were some funny bits. Not enough to make me laugh or smile, but it kept me entertained and what's more important, kept me watching the show. 
The bad:

It didn't distract me from watching the show, but it was pretty noticeable. The style and aesthetic of the series was alright overall but it wouldn't call it "innovating", "good" or "well chosen" or anything like that. \n\n\n

Dear Fellow Otaku/ Anime lovers, :3
If you guys are new to this anime and are trying to pick which anime you should watch next then watch this one! 
You get to see the story of Nanami and her familiars and how she always seems to have an effect on people without even knowing it. Tomoe is her first familiar ( a being who serves a master by a secret contracted made by the two individuals.) a wolf (I'm guessing) demon.... he served for the shrines long before Nanami takes over. After it's recent master passes the role over to her.  Tomoe seems to havethe common dislike for humans for he thinks there are just weak beings and nothing else.  But soon Nanami starts to fall in love with him, and after a while, he starts to realize he loves her too.........

I can usually judge how i'll feel about an anime from the intro and this one was no different. Overall it was very enjoyable to watch with great characters, music and story. On the downside its another anime that doesn't really end. They just picked a good spot to stop. Regardless its worth a watch. I'd best describe this anime as a mash up of fruits basket and tactics. Like fruits basket this average school girl gets stuck living with a bunch of strange men who all have a theme to them (being diff gods) and meets them one by one. She finds the goodin them each and they all end up adoring her. Like tactics there is a strong central theme that humans and demons can't be together but the human is determined to over come that. The love story is a little unexpected at first but it doesn't get in the way of the overall story, which i liked, but we're also not necessarily left in "they'll never be together" land. But like i said it doesn't really end so that's up to you.


Pros:

-cute, light hearted story (great if you just came off a morbid anime and need to do a 180)

-great characters with strong personalities and developed backstories

-really good music

-nice artwork

-even tho the main character is a typical high school girl with a heartbreaking crush she still has a lot of personality and doesn't just give in to everything around her


cons:

-biggest one is that it doesn't really have an ending (manga still publishing)

-because of the above there are a few plot holes even tho the overall story is good (think how fruits basket had plot holes)

-feels a bit rushed sometimes and the progression of time isn't too clear

-if your a person that finds voice actors important i'd really watch this in japanese. the english is good but funimation is so short on new actors all the characters across anime are starting to sound the same. it really bugged me for tomoe's voice just cuz tatum is starting to be over used.

enjoyment-10\n

Kamisama Hajimemashita is a typical Shojou romance/comedy anime.
(8) The story is very interesting, a little exaggerated though. It's not really common seeing mare humans becoming Gods. Another problem would be that, the anime is really short! It only has 13 episodes so, you don't really get to see much of the original story in the manga, only the beginning. There's also a lack of character development due to the shortness of the anime. (9)I guess I'll talk about Nanami and Tomoe, the main characteres.

Well.... because I've also read the manga, I learned more about the characteres.

Anyway, inspite of the missing ch. development, they are built very nicely.

Nanami- is the typical powerful shojou heroine. She has a strong heart, is really king and  a little stupid sometimes.

Tomoe- the cold  Kitsune (fox demon) at the beginning who becomes more and more softer after being Nanami's familiar. I, personally, fell in love whit this character!


(9)I enjoyed every second! It never got boring, it was funny 'till the and it made want to watch more episodes every time I finished one.I just couldn't stop watching. It took me one day to watch the whole show.


(9) Overall, it was a great anime, one of my favourites. If you enjoy a good comedy, you should watch this. It also quite romantic and cute, but almost never too dramatic.

I admit when I first started this anime watching the first episode, I didn't think it was that great, but the more episodes I did watch the more into it I became. I admit I only had decided to watch it because of Tomoe. He was just so hot in all these pictures I've been seeing. Haha.

I want more anime episodes just so I can get more of him. He is definitely the hottest guy and I hope Nanami and Tomoe's relationship could develop further.

Before we get into this, this whole review is what I think of it. In this review I will cover the things I liked and how it showed itself, what I think could be improved, and many more. If I got anything wrong (like an name, or episode), please tell me and I will correct it. Thank you, and this review will have spoilers, because my spoilers could be different from yours. I will try to only talk about the anime, so if you have seen all of it, you are safe.
I really loved this show, and how it showed itself. I watched it allnight long just watching it, but I was disappoint when I saw that they didn't continue the anime to 25 episodes like normally they do.


Storyline:

I really liked it, but this was nothing really new. Even if, they pulled it off pretty well. The supernatural feel made it even better for me to watch, and it never got old. 


Art:

AMAZING! Such beautiful art, and it made it even better, it wasn't an eyesore to me like some animes. 


Sound:

Very well made, they pulled it off very good. Loved it. 


Character(s):


I really liked them, good characters. 


(SPOILER ALERT IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE WHOLE ANIME)

Just one thing I really wanted in the show was Nanami get better at learning her skills of being a god, and it never really was focused on. Doesn't mean it wasn't, I will be lying through my teeth, but still could have been better. 


Enjoyment: 

Over the top, I loved it. Amazing show, a show I will totally recommend to my friends. 


Overall:

Good show, but it isn't the most show in the world. Even if, I will still watch the next season if their is one. 


(SPOILERS ABOUT THEIR ROMANCE IS HERE, DON'T READ IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE WHOLE ANIME)

The romance, is very good, but Tomoe and Nanami's romance was so distant. But I can't complain about it so much because Tomoe was fearful to fall in love with her, so I can't bash the guy so much.
